conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for the practical question.

We can’t commit to a specific round number, because we have to keep our remaining seat available as long as higher-priority candidates could still enter the conversation in later rounds. The clear condition under which we would finalize the seat is: once it becomes evident that higher-priority candidates are no longer in play (e.g., they have matched elsewhere and exited) and our seat is still open, we would then offer the seat to the highest-available applicant who submits an [APPLY] at that time.

As a general guideline (not a guarantee), if we reach a much later stage and the seat is still unfilled, we would be prepared to make an immediate decision that round based on who applies then. If you are still unmatched later on, please check back and submit an [APPLY] again so we can act right away if we’re able.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
